sources.title: Westpac's record $1.3 billion AUSTRAC money laundering fine explained
sources.snippet: Westpac has agreed to pay the largest fine in Australian corporate history — a $1.3 billion civil penalty for more than 23 million breaches of anti-money laundering laws.
sources.query_context: WESTPAC BANKING CORPORATION WESTPAC BANKING CORPORATION anti-money laundering violations

sources.title: Westpac ordered to pay $1.3 billion penalty | AUSTRAC
sources.snippet: The Federal Court of Australia has today ordered Westpac to pay a $1.3 billion penalty for its breaches of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorism Financing Act 2006 (AML/CTF Act). The penalty imposed is the highest civil penalty in Australian history, reflecting the seriousness of compliance failings by Westpac.

sources.title: Westpac New Zealand admits to customer overcharges
sources.snippet: Westpac New Zealand, the local unit of Australian lender Westpac, has admitted to misleading representations that led to customer overcharges totalling NZ$6.35m ($3.59m). This admission came as part of a civil proceeding initiated by New Zealand's Financial Markets Authority (FMA) at the High Court in Auckland.
